text: Cecil James McNeely (April 29, 1927 â€“ September 16, 2018), better known as Big Jay McNeely, was an American rhythm and blues saxophonist. He was born in Los Angeles, California. McNeely's first hit was "The Deacon's Hop," an instrumental which was at the top of the Billboard R&B; chart in early 1949. He was added into The Rhythm and Blues Music Hall of Fame. McNeely died on September 16, 2018 from prostate cancer in Moreno Valley, California at the age of 91. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official Website Big Jay McNeely *Big Jay McNeely MySpace page *Big Jay McNeely page at This is Vintage Now * Dozens of vintage photos and album covers *McNeely stage performance photograph at Soulpatrol.com *Big Jay McNeely and "Detroit" Gary Wiggins - Saxomania Tour Europe *NAMM (National Association of Music Merchants) Oral History Interview with Big Jay McNeely May 23, 2013 Category:1927 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from prostate cancer Category:Cancer deaths in California Category:American saxophonists Category:American R&B; musicians Category:American soul musicians Category:Musicians from Los Angeles
title: Big Jay McNeely
